item.title: The Geometry of Rule
item.description:
The Geometry of Rule

I first read The Prince not out of admiration but suspicion. Its reputation preceded it like a dagger in a dim alleyâ€”Machiavellian, after all, is a byword for cunning, deceit, and political amorality. Yet on reading the slim volume, I was struck not by wickedness, but by clarity. Machiavelli does not corrupt virtue; he strips it of illusion. He writes with the detachment of a surgeon, cutting away the fat of moral sentiment to expose the sinews of power.
